channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Series of large pot holes, 30th January
item.description:
There are a series of pot holes on Dog Lane starting from around 10m from the junction with Dark Lane and running for around 50m towards Bentham Lane. This has previously been reported and I was notified that the problem had been fixed but this was not the case. Last week a single solitary pot hole nearer to the junction with Bentham Lane was filled but nothing was done to address the other reported pot holes in the immediate vicinity. This does not seem to be an efficient use of resources.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dog Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes, 30th January
item.description:
These are classed as emergencies by your own criteria due to the width and depth of the potholes. There are multiple reports already. The emergency helpline is of little help.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken glass, 30th January
item.description:
Broken glass in one of the spaces

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unpermitted roadworks problem, 30th January
item.description:
What are the dates that STW will be closing Noverton Lane. Letters say one date and the signs say something completely different. Web says 2nd Feb, Signs says 6th. N bus route will stop at Prestbury Library. Road closed for 3 estates. Only way out is a single track road. No mentions of TM and there is a ditch at the side of the track. No pull in areas. Not one resident letter at any of the residence. Residence had no knowledge. Only knew because of Facebook and the new signs. Website hasn't been updated. 600 houses. Please can we know what's going on.
Report on FixMyStreet

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 30th January
item.description:
Customer has called and says there is a dipped drain cover outside of the property, They were in the attic and the house sounded like it was in an earth quake. They are concerned that the house will be damaged but have a more pressing concern for the safety for road users. It has sunk around 1 1/2 inches and lorries bang over it. They say this is only an issue since the cycle spine was installed. Please inspect ASAP.
Report on FixMyStreet
